title: Life After Bon Appétit
description:
Referenced in this episode: 

  • Green Chile Cherry Tomato Pickle recipe
  • The Very Best Way to Cook Cherry Tomatoes (Food52)
  • Priya's conversation with Yewande Komolafe (Bon Appétit)

Genius-Hunter Extra-Credit:

  • Make the dahi toast from Priya's very excellent book, Indian-ish
  • View transcript

Have a genius recipe you'd like to share? Tell me all about it! I'm at genius@food52.com.
author: podcasts@food52.com (Kristen Miglore, Priya Krishna)
content:encoded:
Referenced in this episode: 

  • Green Chile Cherry Tomato Pickle recipe
  • The Very Best Way to Cook Cherry Tomatoes (Food52)

Genius-Hunter Extra-Credit:

Have a genius recipe you'd like to share? Tell me all about it! I'm at genius@food52.com.
itunes:title: Life After Bon Appétit
itunes:author: Kristen Miglore, Priya Krishna
itunes:summary: Priya Krishna is not only a food writer, cookbook author, and regular contributor for the New York Times, Bon Appétit, and others—she's also the daughter we want to be when we grow up. Priya joins host Kristen Miglore to discuss what it was like writing a cookbook with her mom, Ritu, what Seth's baking next, and a brilliant, five-minute shortcut spicy-bright pickle that will electrify everything from dal to quesadillas.
itunes:subtitle: Priya Krishna is not only a food writer, cookbook author, and regular contributor for the New York Times, Bon Appétit, and others—she's also the daughter we want to be when we grow up. Priya joins host Kristen Miglore to discuss what it was like writing a cookbook with her mom, Ritu, what Seth's baking next, and a brilliant, five-minute shortcut spicy-bright pickle that will electrify everything from dal to quesadillas.
itunes:keywords: food podcast, bon appetit, food52, food interview, achaar, green chile cherry tomato pickle, indian pickle, chef interview, genius recipe, indianish, priya krishna
